wikipedia_page.main: John James Tompkins (1914–1944) was an English professional footballer who played all his professional career for Fulham Football Club before his death in World War II.

link_mentions.page: List of footballers killed during World War II
response: * Jimmy Tompkins – played for Fulham (1934–1939). A Major in the Royal Fusiliers, he was killed during Normandy campaign on 10 July 1944 aged 30 when attached to Hampshire Regiment.
